AWS and red hat have been strategic
partners for almost a decade now working
since 2008 to make the experience of
running rail on AWS great whether you're
talking about sap applications or Oracle
BS or all kinds of big data and
analytics applications really any
bespoke on premises application is
easily able to run rail on top of AWS
but over the last year or so our joint
customers have been asking us to solve a
couple problems for them first with the
pace of AWS continuing to accelerate in
terms of the Innovation just last year
alone we launched over a, significant
services and features in AWS our
customers want to be able to enjoy all
of that innovation and use ra and so
we've spent the last couple months
together red hat and AWS figuring out
how to Resource our Collective efforts
so that you'll be able to enjoy that
Innovation that AWS is providing faster
than ever the second thing is as more
and more Enterprises are evaluating
running in containers we're excited to
announce a strategic alliance between
AWS and red hat that will provide a
unique offering where Red Hat will
package natively a large number number
of AWS Services into open shift and so
these AWS service Brokers will come
prepackaged into open shift and they'll
allow access to services like Lambda all
of our data services like our relational
database service including Aurora our
data warehouse service and redshift EMR
Athena our CDN and cloudfront our DNS
service and Route 53 our load balancing
service and elb all those services will
be accessible natively in open Shi it
will also allow application developers
who are using open shift to move much
more quickly because you'll have that
consistent environment between on
premises and the cloud and then we'll
also provide a single path where both
red hat and AWS will provide support
such that you can deploy your
applications in production with
confidence I'm really excited about the
extended strategic Alliance I think it's
great for customers and as a customer
whether you intend to go all in in the
cloud and AWS or operate in hybrid
environments AWS and red hat will
partner together to make the experience
as seamless as possible for you to use
the OS and the application development
platform you're used to using on
premises in the cloud as well
